qas.question: What does the USB specification limit?
When is the inrush current affected by the USB specification?

answers.text: when the device is first connected

qas.question: What are USB devices required to enter?

answers.text: ultra low-power suspend mode when the USB host is suspended

qas.question: Many USB host interfaces do not what?

answers.text: cut off the power supply to USB devices when they are suspended

context: In addition to limiting the total average power used by the device, the USB specification limits <a0_0>the inrush current<a0_0/> (i.e., that used to charge decoupling and filter capacitors) <a1_0>when the device is first connected<a1_0/>. Otherwise, connecting a device could cause problems with the host's internal power. USB devices are also required to automatically enter <a2_0>ultra low-power suspend mode when the USB host is suspended<a2_0/>. Nevertheless, many USB host interfaces do not <a3_0>cut off the power supply to USB devices when they are suspended<a3_0/>.
